name: Nationalised Railway
description: We've now nationalised our railways, ensuring that they are Imperial property. We will take good care of them, ensuring that the transportation of goods and troops flows swiftly and efficiently.

name: Privatised Railway
description: We will allow the German-owned railways to continue operation under German personnel, however we will continually monitor them, ensuring that their quality remains of the highest calibre.

name: Expand the Railway
description: Expanding the current railways is system is crucial to the long term benefit of our nation. Lines of communication, the distribution of goods, and the movement of troops are all equally important and will help our nation prosper. Thankfully, the Emperor understands the importance of transportation.

name: Southern Railway Expansion
description: The next step of our railway expansion plan is to connect the southernmost regions of the empire to the rest of our infrastructure and, hopefully, the rest of the nation.

name: Expand the Railway into Eritrea
description: The next step of our railway expansion plan is to connect the empire's only coastal region, Eritrea, to the rest of the nation, improve the prosperity of people living there, and better manage the flow of goods in the region.

name: Impose Amharic onto Eritrea
description: Despite not being ethnically homogenous, Eritrea has a significant amount of Tigray elite, which could, potentially, pose a threat to us in the future. We should take steps to ensure that the language barrier does not give them any sort of advantage and drive home the concept that Eritrea is Ethiopia.

name: Tribal Integration
description: We can sway the Eritrean leadership to our side... if we offer them substantial incentives.

name: Officer Integration
description: Many of our veteran fighters had served under the Italians and others under private militias after the Liberation. We should apply the same principles we'd applied then and take steps to seamlessly integrate the Eritrean forces into the Ethiopian military.

name: Asmara Naval Base
description: We will spare no expense in the creation of a port in Asamara, which will be so grand, that it will blow away the naval empires of today as it will showcase the true naval strength of the empire!

name: Integration of Eritrea
description: Twenty years later, unrest within Eritrea has almost subsided and the people living within the region are beginning to form an optimistic view of the empire. It seems that, in the near future, potential unrest will begin to decline.

name: Develop Eritrea
description: Unlike the Italian imperialists, who had rarely invested in Eritrea, as a show of goodwill, we will begin heavy investments into the region.

name: Invest in Industry
description: Industrialisation is the only way forward. We cannot avoid this crucial policy as the empire requires more factories to boost its production.

name: Southern Industrial Expansion
description: We shall expand our industrialisation programme and create new factories in the southern portion of our nation. That way, profits and jobs from this sector of the economy will be better distributed, boosting both productivity and profit.

name: Military Industrial Expansion
description: As the years go by, it is apparent that our army will require higher quality equipment and adequate supplies. We will begin the mass production of weapons and supplies in order to help our armed forces better defend the empire.

name: Industrial Modernisation
description: Ethiopia is sorely lacking in terms of industrial capacity and manufacturing. On top of that, our economy is extremely small and very isolated. Because of this, we lack an international presence. In order to remedy this, we must take steps to industrialise our economy.

name: Construction of Heavy Industry
description: Proper utilisation of our industrial capacity is paramount in order to fuel the creation of heavy construction material in order to conduct government projects in an efficient manner.

name: Tribal Modernisation
description: We shall guarantee the rights of tribal groups and other minorities so long as they fulfil their obligations!

name: Modernise Coffee Harvesting
description: Due to the chaotic situation in Brazil, a large demand for coffee has recently opened up. We can take advantage of this by modernising our harvesting techniques and growing more coffee plants, thereby producing more coffee beans. Doing so will greatly boost our income as a nation. After all, who doesn't like coffee?

name: Complete the Modernisation
description: Our industrialisation efforts have come to fruition at last. The future is now within our reach; we just need to grasp it!

name: Ethiopian Military on the DKAEB
description: We must demand our German partners allow our troops priority on the DKAEB railroad throughout our lands. Without this, we will be hamstrung by the preference the railroad currently gives to German troops.

name: German Investment
description: Since we have demonstrated our relative stability and unwavering loyalty towards Germany, perhaps they could begin investing abroad, in Ethiopia, to help combat the effects of Black Monday and, in the process, help better develop Ethiopia.

name: German Aid
description: We will ensure Germany does not forgot the assistance we'd provided them with during the Weltkrieg. German investors, private and state-sponsored, will help bring prosperity to Ethiopia.

name: German Military Mission
description: Since we've already reached out to Germany with regards to receiving investment and aid, it would also be in our best interest to request military advisors in order to learn how to better drill our soldiers, improve our tactics, and, overall, modernise our army.

name: A German Partner
description: With our industry booming and local enemies dealt with, it is time to turn our attention to the world at large, and perhaps aid the Germans in this Weltkrieg like we did in the last.

name: Deal with our Debt
description: Upon the conclusion of the Weltkrieg, our national debt had, and has continued to, spiralled out of control. Sorely needed reforms cannot be enacted until the issue of the debt has been fully dealt with.

name: Introduce Taxation to Eritrea
description: We'd freed the Eritreans upon the conclusion of the Weltkrieg and granted them special privileges within the empire. However, the time for them has ended as most Eritreans see themselves as Ethiopians anyway and, if they truly believe themselves worthy of our great nation, they must begin contributing towards the prosperity of the empire.

name: Tax the Oromo
description: The Oromo people have been granted many privileges. We will need to end them in order to promote equality within the empire and improve our budget and, by extension, our ability to pay off our debt.

name: Tax the Church
description: Alas, we must turn to taxing the church as the funds are desperately required by the empire to pay off its debt.

name: Tax Slave-owners
description: A large majority, if not all, slave owners are well off. By taxing slaves, we can extract more wealth from the extremely well-to-do citizens of our nation. While this may be seen as controversial by some, it will be a great boon to our budget.

name: Budget Readjustment
description: Due to budget reform and readjustment, we can finally begin the next step of the Emperor's plan: reforming the Empire.

name: Selassie's Reforms
description: Halie Selassie I is a reformer in the best possible way. He is a dynamic man who understands what is required to modernise Ethiopia and drag it out of the past, which it has been stuck in for far too long. While the path of modernisation will not be easy, it says a lot about the King's character and his willingness to help his nation.

name: The Slavery Question
description: Slavery simply has no place any modern nation, let alone the great empire envisioned by Halie Selassie I. Thankfully, the newly instituted slaveowner tax has meant that it is cheaper to hire workers than own slaves, and so the abolition of slavery will, most likely, not face great opposition. However, it will still be a massive undertaking to heal the social and cultural wounds endured by the oppressed folk.

name: Educate the Slaves
description: With former slaves now free, it is clear that we must take steps to properly integrate them within Ethiopian society. Incidentally, this has also coincided with our plans to reform and expand the education system. By undertaking these planned reforms, we will ensure that the future minds of Ethiopia are well educated!

name: Land Reform
description: Land ownership within Ethiopia still operates based on an archaic system, where the people who hold the land only do so because of their abundant power or wealth. Legal ownership of land is uncommon and this has been a problem for quite a long time. It is time we begin the reformation of land ownership and distribution and actively enforce those laws.

name: Agriculture Initiative
description: Ensuring the existence of an organised agricultural sector, especially a prosperous one, is paramount to the future of the empire. As Ethiopia grows, so does its population and its food consumption. In order to avoid overextending our production capabilities and suffering from famines, we must begin undertaking significant agricultural reforms.

name: The Question of Taxation
description: As it stands, we've no official tax code. In order to westernise our nation, reformation of the tax code is crucial. We currently have a few options in front of us: one, we can support the people and institute a land tax that will primarily fall on the wealthy, two, we can listen to our western advisors and push for a progressive tax system, and, three, we can listen to the aristocrats and institute a low, flat tax.

name: Modernise the Bureaucracy
description: In order to modernise our empire, we must drag ourselves out of the Dark Ages of the Zemene Mesafint and begin centralisation, increasing efficiency within the government and the bureaucracy. Successfully implementing these new ideas, however, will be an arduous task.

name: The Governorship Question
description: Deciding who will govern the various provinces of Ethiopia will be an extremely crucial decision, with many far reaching consequences. That being said, we've a few options in front of us: we can allow the people to elect their respective governors, allow the Negus to appoint governors, or we can allow the upper class to govern their own lands.

name: Permanent Feudal Borders
description: Order and stability within the empire are both of the utmost importance. We must decisively, yet gently, end the infighting between the upper classes lest they remain at each other's throats, threatening the empire's stability.

name: The Military Question
description: Currently, the officers within our army belong to only noble backgrounds or are members of the Selassie family, with commoners being denied promotion to most of the high positions within the military, no matter their competency. Perhaps we could allow commoners to serve as high ranking officers within the army, promoting them based on merit instead of class.

name: Ethiopian Scout Association
description: The Ethiopian youth need to spend their bountiful energy in better, more productive pursuits. What better way to help them do that than by creating the Ethiopian Scout Association, a state-sponsored organisation which will help young men within our nation work on bettering the empire.

name: Finish the Reforms
description: We've finally completed the reformation of the empire, with the only thing left being the ratification of those reformations through the creation of a new constitution.

name: Crush Somalia
description: Ogaden is rightfully ours as mandated by the treaty which had ended the Weltkrieg. However, the weakness of previous rulers and trouble within Eritrea prevented us from enforcing this claim. Since our enemy, the Mad Mullah, is dead and Germany is no longer in a position to intervene in African affairs, we shall strike at Somalia and reclaim the lands that rightfully belong to Ethiopia!

name: New Constitution
description: A new constitution will be written up for the empire, containing and enforcing the reforms made by us during its drafting. The empire shall move forward, now stronger than ever!

name: Pacify the Ogaden
description: The easiest part of conquest is often gaining control of the land itself. However, pacifying the locals and integrating them into Ethiopian society is another matter all together. Integrating Ogaden into Ethiopia is of the utmost importance, so that we may retain control of the land and its people.

name: The Sewochi's Negus
description: The legitimacy of a ruler is derived from the support of his people. Halie Selassie I will be the first Ethiopian emperor to grant control of vast parts of the state's apparatus to democratically elected officials. The voice of the common folk and the disenfranchised shall be heard.

name: Freedom of Speech
description: The people deserve the right to say as they please, no matter if we agree with them or not, and the state should defend their right to say those things. Disagreement is how we, as a nation, can bring forth new ideas and, ultimately, progress.

name: Freedom of Religion
description: Ethiopia, in its lengthy history, has been the home of people of many faiths. From the Jews of old Axum to the Muslims of the walled city of Harar, citizens of Ethiopia, no matter their religion, shall live peacefully and free, equal to all.

name: Enrich the People
description: Poverty prevents our citizens from experiencing potential material gain and prosperity. We must protect even the poorest of our subjects, to ensure that each and every single one of them can possess an optimistic future.

name: Hold Elections
description: Ethiopia, for the first time ever, will organise free and democratic elections. Political parties are beginning to rally, people are getting ready to vote, and many are eager for what lies ahead while others are anxious. Who shall be the first Prime Minister, appointed by His Majesty himself?

name: The Negusa Nagast
description: We've allowed men of inferior character and lesser status to impede Ethiopia's natural progression for far too long. We shall have to take measures to reorganise the empire in such a way that will allow for the Negus to rightfully assume a position of power and authority.

name: Revered Emperor
description: The citizens of Ethiopia must keep in mind that His Majesty, Halie Selassie I, has brought peace, stability, freedom, and justice to the reformed Empire of Ethiopia.

name: Control the Church
description: Those who are faithful require proper guidance. Not from those who would seek earthly power or material possession, but from those who will ensure that peace and stability are maintained within the empire through the blessed rule of the King of Kings.

name: Royal Advisors
description: Only those who are close, and qualified, advisors to the Emperor shall have a say in the governance of His Majesty's empire. That way, we can ensure efficient governance and quality leadership.

name: Lion of Judah
description: From the entourage who had helped escort the Queen of Sheba back home, His Majesty, Selassie, is the embodiment of the symbol of the mighty lion and the 225th king from King David. The greatest of all earthly lords, His Majesty has had a legacy so grand, that it outshines even his mighty efforts to help further Ethiopia's glory.

name: The Mekwanint's Negus
description: The noble lords and ladies of Ethiopia have managed to hold the empire together for millennia and shall continue to do so! Concerns such as the budget and management of the military are too trivial to bother the mighty King of Kings. Instead, his vassals shall tend to these affairs in his stead.

name: Noble Investments
description: We shall ensure that Ethiopia acquires whatever it deems necessary, by any means necessary. No matter the cost nor the people we shall deal with in order to acquire these necessities.

name: Power of Tradition
description: Nobles are of such high stature not because of their blood or ancestral ties, but because they have been trained from birth to obtain and better their skills as administrators, soldiers, or businessmen. Why alter a system that has worked, and will continue to work, for millennia?

name: Mekwanint Armies
description: Our armies possess men who have been trained from birth to effectively and decisively lead our troops. In addition, with the recent acquisition of proper equipment and superior training for our foot soldiers, victory is only a natural outcome against any foe.

name: Power to the Council
description: It is time for a council made up of nobles to seize full power of the government from Selassie's thugs. From now on, Selassie will rule as a King among Kings, remaining a weak figurehead for the council to rally behind, if needed.

name: Military Reforms
description: Our military's performance during the Weltkrieg was, unfortunately, very poor. We shall evaluate the reason for this and discover a proper solution, so that we may reclaim and retake our territory in Ogaden; rightfully ours by treaty and law.

name: Hire Askari Veterans
description: Many of the Askari veterans within Mittelafrika tire of their garrison duty, constantly patrolling for unseen foes. We shall bring them here, where their skills and experience can be properly utilised.

name: New Arms Production
description: We must increase our efforts to better equip our army as, according to the Askari, our handguns are better suited to remain apart of a hunter's collection than remain in an army's arsenal.

name: Import Small Arms
description: The poor state and quality of our handguns can be improved, however, with some effort on our part by reverse engineering foreign models. The issue, however, is purchasing said guns.

name: Artillery Effort
description: As the Weltkrieg has shown us, and the rest of the world, artillery is an extremely vital part of modern warfare. Yet, we've never been able to master these large-calibre guns. Thankfully, our foreign advisors understand how to design and man these shell-firing guns.

name: Buy Tanks Designs
description: While tanks and other mechanised vehicles may be ill suited for the highlands of Gondar, they may make all the difference in the flat plains of Ogaden and could be the deciding factor on whether or not we experience victory or defeat.

name: Foreign Doctrine
description: The military high command has reached a unanimous conclusion: Hurling wave after wave of militia at the enemy may not be the best course of action. Perhaps it would be best to ask our foreign officers/advisors what would be the best course of action? Noble officers can be rather stubborn, after all...

name: Modernise High Command
description: Perhaps we should refine our military doctrine and, instead of attacking the enemy with the use of brute force, we should choose men who are patient, proper, and skilled to plan and lead our army.

name: Legacy of Adowa
description: We cannot nor will we ever rely on foreigners to acquire victory. The people of the world have, for far too long, forgotten the might of the Victory of Adwa. All of Africa shall see us for what we truly are; the mighty lion!

name: Ethiopian Guns
description: By utilising foreign expertise and basing our designs off of external blueprints, we can ensure Ethiopian-made guns, made by Ethiopians for Ethiopians, are of the highest calibre whilst remaining inexpensive.

name: Special Equipment
description: Ensuring that our brave men have anything and everything at their disposal is important to aid them in the continual fight for the empire's independence and victory.

name: Anti-imperialist Spirit
description: Those who attempt to conquer us continually underestimate our spirit and determination. From Wofla to Adwa, envious and unscrupulous vultures attempt to break our spirit and subjugate the people of Ethiopia. So long as our spirit lives on, they shall never succeed!

name: Improve Drilling
description: We will sharpen minds, tire legs, train arms, and, through relentless drilling, shape these ragged folk we call 'soldiers' in to proper and trim fighting men!

name: Trust our Officers
description: Ensuring that our officers have a greater degree of autonomy in the battlefield is extremely crucial, as that would enable them to adapt to the ever changing landscape of modern war.

name: Develop Weapons
description: Rather than purely copying advanced techniques, we should also ensure that our guns are designed and built within the empire, for the men of the empire.

name: Professional Army
description: We have managed to triumph in resolving the failures of our army and have turned them into advantageous successes. Our army, which was once a mass of conscripted men, has now become a truly proper and organised fighting force. We can now direct our focus towards our peacetime affairs, as we are truly prepared in the case of a war.

name: Control of the Sky
description: Control of the skies are within our reach, but it could soon slip out of our grasp. News has reached Addis Ababa that Somalia is planning the purchase of more airplanes in order to expand its air force. The goal of this blatant escalation of tensions is obvious and shall not go unanswered!

name: Hire Aviation Experts
description: In order to truly wrest control of the skies, it is clear that we will require the advice of experienced foreign experts. When we acquire the skills these experts possess, only then can we fully wrest full aerial control of the Horn!

name: Fighter Focus
description: Ensuring the aerial dominance of the Horn will be a difficult task, no matter who you ask. However, we believe that, with the reformation of our air force, we can successfully accomplish the endeavour.

name: Bomber Focus
description: The undertaking of the creation of new bombers will be extremely beneficial to the Ethiopian war effort. The cities, ports, and supply lines of our enemies shall be within the reach of our airplanes to raze. We will emerge triumphant!

name: CAS Effort
description: Controlling the battlefield from the air is an attractive prospect; However, possessing the aircraft and the pilots capable of doing so is both expensive and time consuming.

name: Advanced Doctrine
description: Planning air missions is a rather complicated matter due to the sheer amount of factors that must be taken into account. Weather, distance, and the number of enemy forces must all be equally considered. However, most of our pilots are either not qualified or talented enough to understand the basics of aerial planning. Training them would be the obvious resolution to such an issue.

name: Train our Pilots
description: Possessing planes means little if our pilots are unable to skilfully and properly fly them. The Imperial Air Force can become a force to be reckoned with, however we must give it the attention it deserves before it can reach such a level.

name: Skylions
description: The training of a group of men, who rank amongst the best of our pilots, shall take place. They will, with the heart of a lion, fall straight from the skies into battle and strike where we could never hope to reach and win the fight we could never hope to win!

name: The Harer Airbase
description: The existing airfield within Harar shall undergo an expansion in order to prepare for the upcoming war against Somalia. The aerial high command projects that, if the airfield does undergo expansion, our planes can reach even the farthest point of Somalia.

name: Naval Planning Effort
description: Understanding naval tactics is far more than merely steering a ship towards enemy waters. Missions and operational hierarchy are vital components of any naval doctrine. Thankfully, because of its young age, our navy is flexible and able to adapt to any sort of change.

name: Submarine Effort
description: Because of the strategic location of our ports, near the Gulf of Aden, it is important that we invest in submarine technology in order to destroy enemy shipping lanes and, subsequently, starve them of desperately needed supplies.

name: Submarine Doctrine
description: A grand blockade of the Red Sea shall be planned in order for us to better control shipping lanes in the area. No convoy shall be given permission to pass through, unless we deem it fit to do so.

name: Destroyer Effort
description: Ensuring our convoys are safe from enemy raiding efforts is crucial. Because of this, the creation of anti-submarine vessels with patrols, who will maintain watch regularly, is in order.

name: Cruiser Effort
description: The navy will require more tonnage if we are to attain full control of the Horn. Cruisers will be paramount to this effort, especially if the projections of Somalian naval power are correct.

name: Naval Doctrine Reform
description: The creation of a proper school for prospective naval officers is paramount to the war at sea. As war fast approaches, we must ensure that our officers are ready to adapt and conquer the ever changing tactics at sea.
